intro: Ruellia serrana, commonly known as the serrated ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Ruellia serrana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
